00048 /*
00049  * ASSERT NOTE:
00050  * Some sanity checking code is included using assert().  On my FreeBSD
00051  * system, this additional code can be removed by compiling with NDEBUG
00052  * defined.  Check your own systems manpage on assert() to see how to
00053  * compile WITHOUT the sanity checking code on your system.
00054  *
00055  * UNROLLED TRANSFORM LOOP NOTE:
00056  * You can define SHA2_UNROLL_TRANSFORM to use the unrolled transform
00057  * loop version for the hash transform rounds (defined using macros
00058  * later in this file).  Either define on the command line, for example:
00059  *
00060  *   cc -DSHA2_UNROLL_TRANSFORM -o sha2 sha2.c sha2prog.c
00061  *
00062  * or define below:
00063  *
00064  *   #define SHA2_UNROLL_TRANSFORM
00065  *
00066  */
00067 
00068  #define SHA2_UNROLL_TRANSFORM

00071 /*** SHA-256/384/512 Machine Architecture Definitions *****************/
00072 /*
00073  * BYTE_ORDER NOTE:
00074  *
00075  * Please make sure that your system defines BYTE_ORDER.  If your
00076  * architecture is little-endian, make sure it also defines
00077  * LITTLE_ENDIAN and that the two (BYTE_ORDER and LITTLE_ENDIAN) are
00078  * equivilent.
00079  *
00080  * If your system does not define the above, then you can do so by
00081  * hand like this:
00082  *
00083  *   #define LITTLE_ENDIAN 1234
00084  *   #define BIG_ENDIAN    4321
00085  *
00086  * And for little-endian machines, add:
00087  *
00088  *   #define BYTE_ORDER LITTLE_ENDIAN 
00089  *
00090  * Or for big-endian machines:
00091  *
00092  *   #define BYTE_ORDER BIG_ENDIAN
00093  *
00094  * The FreeBSD machine this was written on defines BYTE_ORDER
00095  * appropriately by including <sys/types.h> (which in turn includes
00096  * <machine/endian.h> where the appropriate definitions are actually
00097  * made).
00098  */
00099 #if !defined(__BYTE_ORDER)
00100 # if __DARWIN_BYTE_ORDER == __DARWIN_LITTLE_ENDIAN
00101 #  define __BYTE_ORDER __LITTLE_ENDIAN
00102 # elif __DARWIN_BYTE_ORDER == __DARWIN_BIG_ENDIAN
00103 #  define __BYTE_ORDER __BIG_ENDIAN
00104 # endif
00105 #endif
00106 
00107 #if !defined(__BYTE_ORDER) || (__BYTE_ORDER != __LITTLE_ENDIAN && __BYTE_ORDER != __BIG_ENDIAN)
00108 #error Define __BYTE_ORDER to be equal to either __LITTLE_ENDIAN or __BIG_ENDIAN
00109 #endif
00110 
00111 /*
00112  * Define the following sha2_* types to types of the correct length on
00113  * the native archtecture.   Most BSD systems and Linux define u_intXX_t
00114  * types.  Machines with very recent ANSI C headers, can use the
00115  * uintXX_t definintions from inttypes.h by defining SHA2_USE_INTTYPES_H
00116  * during compile or in the sha.h header file.
00117  *
00118  * Machines that support neither u_intXX_t nor inttypes.h's uintXX_t
00119  * will need to define these three typedefs below (and the appropriate
00120  * ones in sha.h too) by hand according to their system architecture.
00121  *
00122  * Thank you, Jun-ichiro itojun Hagino, for suggesting using u_intXX_t
00123  * types and pointing out recent ANSI C support for uintXX_t in inttypes.h.
00124  */
00125 typedef uint8_t  sha2_byte;     /* Exactly 1 byte */
00126 typedef uint32_t sha2_word32;   /* Exactly 4 bytes */
00127 typedef uint64_t sha2_word64;   /* Exactly 8 bytes */
00128 
00129 
00130 /*** SHA-256/384/512 Various Length Definitions ***********************/
00131 /* NOTE: Most of these are in sha2.h */
00132 #define SHA256_SHORT_BLOCK_LENGTH       (SHA256_BLOCK_LENGTH - 8)
00133 #define SHA384_SHORT_BLOCK_LENGTH       (SHA384_BLOCK_LENGTH - 16)
00134 #define SHA512_SHORT_BLOCK_LENGTH       (SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH - 16)
00135 
00136 
00137 /*** ENDIAN REVERSAL MACROS *******************************************/
00138 #if __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN
00139 #define REVERSE32(w,x)  { \
00140         sha2_word32 tmp = (w); \
00141         tmp = (tmp >> 16) | (tmp << 16); \
00142         (x) = ((tmp & 0xff00ff00UL) >> 8) | ((tmp & 0x00ff00ffUL) << 8); \
00143 }
00144 #define REVERSE64(w,x)  { \
00145         sha2_word64 tmp = (w); \
00146         tmp = (tmp >> 32) | (tmp << 32); \
00147         tmp = ((tmp & 0xff00ff00ff00ff00ULL) >> 8) | \
00148               ((tmp & 0x00ff00ff00ff00ffULL) << 8); \
00149         (x) = ((tmp & 0xffff0000ffff0000ULL) >> 16) | \
00150               ((tmp & 0x0000ffff0000ffffULL) << 16); \
00151 }
00152 #endif /* __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN */
00153 
00154 /*
00155  * Macro for incrementally adding the unsigned 64-bit integer n to the
00156  * unsigned 128-bit integer (represented using a two-element array of
00157  * 64-bit words):
00158  */
00159 #define ADDINC128(w,n)  { \
00160         (w)[0] += (sha2_word64)(n); \
00161         if ((w)[0] < (n)) { \
00162                 (w)[1]++; \
00163         } \
00164 }
00165 
00166 /*
00167  * Macros for copying blocks of memory and for zeroing out ranges
00168  * of memory.  Using these macros makes it easy to switch from
00169  * using memset()/memcpy() and using bzero()/bcopy().
00170  *
00171  * Please define either SHA2_USE_MEMSET_MEMCPY or define
00172  * SHA2_USE_BZERO_BCOPY depending on which function set you
00173  * choose to use:
00174  */
00175 #if !defined(SHA2_USE_MEMSET_MEMCPY) && !defined(SHA2_USE_BZERO_BCOPY)
00176 /* Default to memset()/memcpy() if no option is specified */
00177 #define SHA2_USE_MEMSET_MEMCPY  1
00178 #endif
00179 #if defined(SHA2_USE_MEMSET_MEMCPY) && defined(SHA2_USE_BZERO_BCOPY)
00180 /* Abort with an error if BOTH options are defined */
00181 #error Define either SHA2_USE_MEMSET_MEMCPY or SHA2_USE_BZERO_BCOPY, not both!
00182 #endif
00183 
00184 #ifdef SHA2_USE_MEMSET_MEMCPY
00185 #define MEMSET_BZERO(p,l)       memset((p), 0, (l))
00186 #define MEMCPY_BCOPY(d,s,l)     memcpy((d), (s), (l))
00187 #endif
00188 #ifdef SHA2_USE_BZERO_BCOPY
00189 #define MEMSET_BZERO(p,l)       bzero((p), (l))
00190 #define MEMCPY_BCOPY(d,s,l)     bcopy((s), (d), (l))
00191 #endif
00192 
00193 
00194 /*** THE SIX LOGICAL FUNCTIONS ****************************************/
00195 /*
00196  * Bit shifting and rotation (used by the six SHA-XYZ logical functions:
00197  *
00198  *   NOTE:  The naming of R and S appears backwards here (R is a SHIFT and
00199  *   S is a ROTATION) because the SHA-256/384/512 description document
00200  *   (see http://csrc.nist.gov/cryptval/shs/sha256-384-512.pdf) uses this
00201  *   same "backwards" definition.
00202  */
00203 /* Shift-right (used in SHA-256, SHA-384, and SHA-512): */
00204 #define R(b,x)          ((x) >> (b))
00205 /* 32-bit Rotate-right (used in SHA-256): */
00206 #define S32(b,x)        (((x) >> (b)) | ((x) << (32 - (b))))
00207 /* 64-bit Rotate-right (used in SHA-384 and SHA-512): */
00208 #define S64(b,x)        (((x) >> (b)) | ((x) << (64 - (b))))
00209 
00210 /* Two of six logical functions used in SHA-256, SHA-384, and SHA-512: */
00211 #define Ch(x,y,z)       (((x) & (y)) ^ ((~(x)) & (z)))
00212 #define Maj(x,y,z)      (((x) & (y)) ^ ((x) & (z)) ^ ((y) & (z)))
00213 
00214 /* Four of six logical functions used in SHA-256: */
00215 #define Sigma0_256(x)   (S32(2,  (x)) ^ S32(13, (x)) ^ S32(22, (x)))
00216 #define Sigma1_256(x)   (S32(6,  (x)) ^ S32(11, (x)) ^ S32(25, (x)))
00217 #define sigma0_256(x)   (S32(7,  (x)) ^ S32(18, (x)) ^ R(3 ,   (x)))
00218 #define sigma1_256(x)   (S32(17, (x)) ^ S32(19, (x)) ^ R(10,   (x)))
00219 
00220 /* Four of six logical functions used in SHA-384 and SHA-512: */
00221 #define Sigma0_512(x)   (S64(28, (x)) ^ S64(34, (x)) ^ S64(39, (x)))
00222 #define Sigma1_512(x)   (S64(14, (x)) ^ S64(18, (x)) ^ S64(41, (x)))
00223 #define sigma0_512(x)   (S64( 1, (x)) ^ S64( 8, (x)) ^ R( 7,   (x)))
00224 #define sigma1_512(x)   (S64(19, (x)) ^ S64(61, (x)) ^ R( 6,   (x)))
00225 
00226 /*** INTERNAL FUNCTION PROTOTYPES *************************************/
00227 /* NOTE: These should not be accessed directly from outside this
00228  * library -- they are intended for private internal visibility/use
00229  * only.
00230  */
00231 static void SHA512_Last(SHA512_CTX*);
00232 static void SHA256_Transform(SHA256_CTX*, const sha2_word32*);
00233 static void SHA512_Transform(SHA512_CTX*, const sha2_word64*);

00344 /*** SHA-256: *********************************************************/
00345 void sat_SHA256_Init(SHA256_CTX* context) {
00346         if (context == (SHA256_CTX*)0) {
00347                 return;
00348         }
00349         MEMCPY_BCOPY(context->state, sha256_initial_hash_value, SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH);
00350         MEMSET_BZERO(context->buffer, SHA256_BLOCK_LENGTH);
00351         context->bitcount = 0;
00352 }
00353 
00354 #ifdef SHA2_UNROLL_TRANSFORM
00355 
00356 /* Unrolled SHA-256 round macros: */
00357 
00358 #if __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN
00359 
00360 #define ROUND256_0_TO_15(a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h)       \
00361         REVERSE32(*data++, W256[j]); \
00362         T1 = (h) + Sigma1_256(e) + Ch((e), (f), (g)) + \
00363              K256[j] + W256[j]; \
00364         (d) += T1; \
00365         (h) = T1 + Sigma0_256(a) + Maj((a), (b), (c)); \
00366         j++
00367 
00368 
00369 #else /* __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN */
00370 
00371 #define ROUND256_0_TO_15(a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h)       \
00372         T1 = (h) + Sigma1_256(e) + Ch((e), (f), (g)) + \
00373              K256[j] + (W256[j] = *data++); \
00374         (d) += T1; \
00375         (h) = T1 + Sigma0_256(a) + Maj((a), (b), (c)); \
00376         j++
00377 
00378 #endif /* __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN */
00379 
00380 #define ROUND256(a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h)       \
00381         s0 = W256[(j+1)&0x0f]; \
00382         s0 = sigma0_256(s0); \
00383         s1 = W256[(j+14)&0x0f]; \
00384         s1 = sigma1_256(s1); \
00385         T1 = (h) + Sigma1_256(e) + Ch((e), (f), (g)) + K256[j] + \
00386              (W256[j&0x0f] += s1 + W256[(j+9)&0x0f] + s0); \
00387         (d) += T1; \
00388         (h) = T1 + Sigma0_256(a) + Maj((a), (b), (c)); \
00389         j++
00390 
00391 static void SHA256_Transform(SHA256_CTX* context, const sha2_word32* data) {
00392         sha2_word32     a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, s0, s1;
00393         sha2_word32     T1, *W256;
00394         int             j;
00395 
00396         W256 = (sha2_word32*)context->buffer;
00397 
00398         /* Initialize registers with the prev. intermediate value */
00399         a = context->state[0];
00400         b = context->state[1];
00401         c = context->state[2];
00402         d = context->state[3];
00403         e = context->state[4];
00404         f = context->state[5];
00405         g = context->state[6];
00406         h = context->state[7];
00407 
00408         j = 0;
00409         do {
00410                 /* Rounds 0 to 15 (unrolled): */
00411                 ROUND256_0_TO_15(a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h);
00412                 ROUND256_0_TO_15(h,a,b,c,d,e,f,g);
00413                 ROUND256_0_TO_15(g,h,a,b,c,d,e,f);
00414                 ROUND256_0_TO_15(f,g,h,a,b,c,d,e);
00415                 ROUND256_0_TO_15(e,f,g,h,a,b,c,d);
00416                 ROUND256_0_TO_15(d,e,f,g,h,a,b,c);
00417                 ROUND256_0_TO_15(c,d,e,f,g,h,a,b);
00418                 ROUND256_0_TO_15(b,c,d,e,f,g,h,a);
00419         } while (j < 16);
00420 
00421         /* Now for the remaining rounds to 64: */
00422         do {
00423                 ROUND256(a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h);
00424                 ROUND256(h,a,b,c,d,e,f,g);
00425                 ROUND256(g,h,a,b,c,d,e,f);
00426                 ROUND256(f,g,h,a,b,c,d,e);
00427                 ROUND256(e,f,g,h,a,b,c,d);
00428                 ROUND256(d,e,f,g,h,a,b,c);
00429                 ROUND256(c,d,e,f,g,h,a,b);
00430                 ROUND256(b,c,d,e,f,g,h,a);
00431         } while (j < 64);
00432 
00433         /* Compute the current intermediate hash value */
00434         context->state[0] += a;
00435         context->state[1] += b;
00436         context->state[2] += c;
00437         context->state[3] += d;
00438         context->state[4] += e;
00439         context->state[5] += f;
00440         context->state[6] += g;
00441         context->state[7] += h;
00442 
00443         /* Clean up */
00444         a = b = c = d = e = f = g = h = T1 = 0;
00445 }
00446 
00447 #else /* SHA2_UNROLL_TRANSFORM */
00448 
00449 static void SHA256_Transform(SHA256_CTX* context, const sha2_word32* data) {
00450         sha2_word32     a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, s0, s1;
00451         sha2_word32     T1, T2, *W256;
00452         int             j;
00453 
00454         W256 = (sha2_word32*)context->buffer;
00455 
00456         /* Initialize registers with the prev. intermediate value */
00457         a = context->state[0];
00458         b = context->state[1];
00459         c = context->state[2];
00460         d = context->state[3];
00461         e = context->state[4];
00462         f = context->state[5];
00463         g = context->state[6];
00464         h = context->state[7];
00465 
00466         j = 0;
00467         do {
00468 #if __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN
00469                 /* Copy data while converting to host byte order */
00470                 REVERSE32(*data++,W256[j]);
00471                 /* Apply the SHA-256 compression function to update a..h */
00472                 T1 = h + Sigma1_256(e) + Ch(e, f, g) + K256[j] + W256[j];
00473 #else /* __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN */
00474                 /* Apply the SHA-256 compression function to update a..h with copy */
00475                 T1 = h + Sigma1_256(e) + Ch(e, f, g) + K256[j] + (W256[j] = *data++);
00476 #endif /* __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN */
00477                 T2 = Sigma0_256(a) + Maj(a, b, c);
00478                 h = g;
00479                 g = f;
00480                 f = e;
00481                 e = d + T1;
00482                 d = c;
00483                 c = b;
00484                 b = a;
00485                 a = T1 + T2;
00486 
00487                 j++;
00488         } while (j < 16);
00489 
00490         do {
00491                 /* Part of the message block expansion: */
00492                 s0 = W256[(j+1)&0x0f];
00493                 s0 = sigma0_256(s0);
00494                 s1 = W256[(j+14)&0x0f]; 
00495                 s1 = sigma1_256(s1);
00496 
00497                 /* Apply the SHA-256 compression function to update a..h */
00498                 T1 = h + Sigma1_256(e) + Ch(e, f, g) + K256[j] + 
00499                      (W256[j&0x0f] += s1 + W256[(j+9)&0x0f] + s0);
00500                 T2 = Sigma0_256(a) + Maj(a, b, c);
00501                 h = g;
00502                 g = f;
00503                 f = e;
00504                 e = d + T1;
00505                 d = c;
00506                 c = b;
00507                 b = a;
00508                 a = T1 + T2;
00509 
00510                 j++;
00511         } while (j < 64);
00512 
00513         /* Compute the current intermediate hash value */
00514         context->state[0] += a;
00515         context->state[1] += b;
00516         context->state[2] += c;
00517         context->state[3] += d;
00518         context->state[4] += e;
00519         context->state[5] += f;
00520         context->state[6] += g;
00521         context->state[7] += h;
00522 
00523         /* Clean up */
00524         a = b = c = d = e = f = g = h = T1 = T2 = 0;
00525 }
00526 
00527 #endif /* SHA2_UNROLL_TRANSFORM */
00528 
00529 void sat_SHA256_Update(SHA256_CTX* context, const sha2_byte *data, size_t len) {
00530         unsigned int    freespace, usedspace;
00531 
00532         if (len == 0) {
00533                 /* Calling with no data is valid - we do nothing */
00534                 return;
00535         }
00536 
00537         /* Sanity check: */
00538         /* assert(context != (SHA256_CTX*)0 && data != (sha2_byte*)0); */
00539 
00540         usedspace = (context->bitcount >> 3) % SHA256_BLOCK_LENGTH;
00541         if (usedspace > 0) {
00542                 /* Calculate how much free space is available in the buffer */
00543                 freespace = SHA256_BLOCK_LENGTH - usedspace;
00544 
00545                 if (len >= freespace) {
00546                         /* Fill the buffer completely and process it */
00547                         MEMCPY_BCOPY(&context->buffer[usedspace], data, freespace);
00548                         context->bitcount += freespace << 3;
00549                         len -= freespace;
00550                         data += freespace;
00551                         SHA256_Transform(context, (sha2_word32*)context->buffer);
00552                 } else {
00553                         /* The buffer is not yet full */
00554                         MEMCPY_BCOPY(&context->buffer[usedspace], data, len);
00555                         context->bitcount += len << 3;
00556                         /* Clean up: */
00557                         usedspace = freespace = 0;
00558                         return;
00559                 }
00560         }
00561         while (len >= SHA256_BLOCK_LENGTH) {
00562                 /* Process as many complete blocks as we can */
00563                 SHA256_Transform(context, (sha2_word32*)data);
00564                 context->bitcount += SHA256_BLOCK_LENGTH << 3;
00565                 len -= SHA256_BLOCK_LENGTH;
00566                 data += SHA256_BLOCK_LENGTH;
00567         }
00568         if (len > 0) {
00569                 /* There's left-overs, so save 'em */
00570                 MEMCPY_BCOPY(context->buffer, data, len);
00571                 context->bitcount += len << 3;
00572         }
00573         /* Clean up: */
00574         usedspace = freespace = 0;
00575 }
00576 
00577 void sat_SHA256_Final(sha2_byte digest[], SHA256_CTX* context) {
00578         sha2_word32     *d = (sha2_word32*)digest;
00579         unsigned int    usedspace;
00580 
00581         /* Sanity check: */
00582         /* assert(context != (SHA256_CTX*)0); */
00583 
00584         /* If no digest buffer is passed, we don't bother doing this: */
00585         if (digest != (sha2_byte*)0) {
00586                 usedspace = (context->bitcount >> 3) % SHA256_BLOCK_LENGTH;
00587 #if __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN
00588                 /* Convert FROM host byte order */
00589                 REVERSE64(context->bitcount,context->bitcount);
00590 #endif
00591                 if (usedspace > 0) {
00592                         /* Begin padding with a 1 bit: */
00593                         context->buffer[usedspace++] = 0x80;
00594 
00595                         if (usedspace <= SHA256_SHORT_BLOCK_LENGTH) {
00596                                 /* Set-up for the last transform: */
00597                                 MEMSET_BZERO(&context->buffer[usedspace], SHA256_SHORT_BLOCK_LENGTH - usedspace);
00598                         } else {
00599                                 if (usedspace < SHA256_BLOCK_LENGTH) {
00600                                         MEMSET_BZERO(&context->buffer[usedspace], SHA256_BLOCK_LENGTH - usedspace);
00601                                 }
00602                                 /* Do second-to-last transform: */
00603                                 SHA256_Transform(context, (sha2_word32*)context->buffer);
00604 
00605                                 /* And set-up for the last transform: */
00606                                 MEMSET_BZERO(context->buffer, SHA256_SHORT_BLOCK_LENGTH);
00607                         }
00608                 } else {
00609                         /* Set-up for the last transform: */
00610                         MEMSET_BZERO(context->buffer, SHA256_SHORT_BLOCK_LENGTH);
00611 
00612                         /* Begin padding with a 1 bit: */
00613                         *context->buffer = 0x80;
00614                 }
00615                 /* Set the bit count: */
00616                 *(sha2_word64*)&context->buffer[SHA256_SHORT_BLOCK_LENGTH] = context->bitcount;
00617 
00618                 /* Final transform: */
00619                 SHA256_Transform(context, (sha2_word32*)context->buffer);
00620 
00621 #if __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN
00622                 {
00623                         /* Convert TO host byte order */
00624                         int     j;
00625                         for (j = 0; j < 8; j++) {
00626                                 REVERSE32(context->state[j],context->state[j]);
00627                                 *d++ = context->state[j];
00628                         }
00629                 }
00630 #else
00631                 MEMCPY_BCOPY(d, context->state, SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH);
00632 #endif
00633         }
00634 
00635         /* Clean up state data: */
00636         MEMSET_BZERO(context, sizeof(context));
00637         usedspace = 0;
00638 }
00639 
00640 char *sat_SHA256_End(SHA256_CTX* context, char buffer[]) {
00641         sha2_byte       digest[SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH], *d = digest;
00642         int             i;
00643 
00644         /* Sanity check: */
00645         /* assert(context != (SHA256_CTX*)0); */
00646 
00647         if (buffer != (char*)0) {
00648                 sat_SHA256_Final(digest, context);
00649 
00650                 for (i = 0; i < SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH; i++) {
00651                         *buffer++ = sha2_hex_digits[(*d & 0xf0) >> 4];
00652                         *buffer++ = sha2_hex_digits[*d & 0x0f];
00653                         d++;
00654                 }
00655                 *buffer = (char)0;
00656         } else {
00657                 MEMSET_BZERO(context, sizeof(context));
00658         }
00659         MEMSET_BZERO(digest, SHA256_DIGEST_LENGTH);
00660         return buffer;
00661 }
00662 
00663 char* sat_SHA256_Data(const sha2_byte* data, size_t len, char digest[SHA256_DIGEST_STRING_LENGTH]) {
00664         SHA256_CTX      context;
00665 
00666         sat_SHA256_Init(&context);
00667         sat_SHA256_Update(&context, data, len);
00668         return sat_SHA256_End(&context, digest);
00669 }
00670 
00671 
00672 /*** SHA-512: *********************************************************/
00673 void sat_SHA512_Init(SHA512_CTX* context) {
00674         if (context == (SHA512_CTX*)0) {
00675                 return;
00676         }
00677         MEMCPY_BCOPY(context->state, sha512_initial_hash_value, SHA512_DIGEST_LENGTH);
00678         MEMSET_BZERO(context->buffer, SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH);
00679         context->bitcount[0] = context->bitcount[1] =  0;
00680 }
00681 
00682 #ifdef SHA2_UNROLL_TRANSFORM
00683 
00684 /* Unrolled SHA-512 round macros: */
00685 #if __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN
00686 
00687 #define ROUND512_0_TO_15(a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h)       \
00688         REVERSE64(*data++, W512[j]); \
00689         T1 = (h) + Sigma1_512(e) + Ch((e), (f), (g)) + \
00690              K512[j] + W512[j]; \
00691         (d) += T1, \
00692         (h) = T1 + Sigma0_512(a) + Maj((a), (b), (c)), \
00693         j++
00694 
00695 
00696 #else /* __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN */
00697 
00698 #define ROUND512_0_TO_15(a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h)       \
00699         T1 = (h) + Sigma1_512(e) + Ch((e), (f), (g)) + \
00700              K512[j] + (W512[j] = *data++); \
00701         (d) += T1; \
00702         (h) = T1 + Sigma0_512(a) + Maj((a), (b), (c)); \
00703         j++
00704 
00705 #endif /* __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN */
00706 
00707 #define ROUND512(a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h)       \
00708         s0 = W512[(j+1)&0x0f]; \
00709         s0 = sigma0_512(s0); \
00710         s1 = W512[(j+14)&0x0f]; \
00711         s1 = sigma1_512(s1); \
00712         T1 = (h) + Sigma1_512(e) + Ch((e), (f), (g)) + K512[j] + \
00713              (W512[j&0x0f] += s1 + W512[(j+9)&0x0f] + s0); \
00714         (d) += T1; \
00715         (h) = T1 + Sigma0_512(a) + Maj((a), (b), (c)); \
00716         j++
00717 
00718 static void SHA512_Transform(SHA512_CTX* context, const sha2_word64* data) {
00719         sha2_word64     a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, s0, s1;
00720         sha2_word64     T1, *W512 = (sha2_word64*)context->buffer;
00721         int             j;
00722 
00723         /* Initialize registers with the prev. intermediate value */
00724         a = context->state[0];
00725         b = context->state[1];
00726         c = context->state[2];
00727         d = context->state[3];
00728         e = context->state[4];
00729         f = context->state[5];
00730         g = context->state[6];
00731         h = context->state[7];
00732 
00733         j = 0;
00734         do {
00735                 ROUND512_0_TO_15(a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h);
00736                 ROUND512_0_TO_15(h,a,b,c,d,e,f,g);
00737                 ROUND512_0_TO_15(g,h,a,b,c,d,e,f);
00738                 ROUND512_0_TO_15(f,g,h,a,b,c,d,e);
00739                 ROUND512_0_TO_15(e,f,g,h,a,b,c,d);
00740                 ROUND512_0_TO_15(d,e,f,g,h,a,b,c);
00741                 ROUND512_0_TO_15(c,d,e,f,g,h,a,b);
00742                 ROUND512_0_TO_15(b,c,d,e,f,g,h,a);
00743         } while (j < 16);
00744 
00745         /* Now for the remaining rounds up to 79: */
00746         do {
00747                 ROUND512(a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h);
00748                 ROUND512(h,a,b,c,d,e,f,g);
00749                 ROUND512(g,h,a,b,c,d,e,f);
00750                 ROUND512(f,g,h,a,b,c,d,e);
00751                 ROUND512(e,f,g,h,a,b,c,d);
00752                 ROUND512(d,e,f,g,h,a,b,c);
00753                 ROUND512(c,d,e,f,g,h,a,b);
00754                 ROUND512(b,c,d,e,f,g,h,a);
00755         } while (j < 80);
00756 
00757         /* Compute the current intermediate hash value */
00758         context->state[0] += a;
00759         context->state[1] += b;
00760         context->state[2] += c;
00761         context->state[3] += d;
00762         context->state[4] += e;
00763         context->state[5] += f;
00764         context->state[6] += g;
00765         context->state[7] += h;
00766 
00767         /* Clean up */
00768         a = b = c = d = e = f = g = h = T1 = 0;
00769 }
00770 
00771 #else /* SHA2_UNROLL_TRANSFORM */
00772 
00773 static void SHA512_Transform(SHA512_CTX* context, const sha2_word64* data) {
00774         sha2_word64     a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, s0, s1;
00775         sha2_word64     T1, T2, *W512 = (sha2_word64*)context->buffer;
00776         int             j;
00777 
00778         /* Initialize registers with the prev. intermediate value */
00779         a = context->state[0];
00780         b = context->state[1];
00781         c = context->state[2];
00782         d = context->state[3];
00783         e = context->state[4];
00784         f = context->state[5];
00785         g = context->state[6];
00786         h = context->state[7];
00787 
00788         j = 0;
00789         do {
00790 #if __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN
00791                 /* Convert TO host byte order */
00792                 REVERSE64(*data++, W512[j]);
00793                 /* Apply the SHA-512 compression function to update a..h */
00794                 T1 = h + Sigma1_512(e) + Ch(e, f, g) + K512[j] + W512[j];
00795 #else /* __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN */
00796                 /* Apply the SHA-512 compression function to update a..h with copy */
00797                 T1 = h + Sigma1_512(e) + Ch(e, f, g) + K512[j] + (W512[j] = *data++);
00798 #endif /* __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN */
00799                 T2 = Sigma0_512(a) + Maj(a, b, c);
00800                 h = g;
00801                 g = f;
00802                 f = e;
00803                 e = d + T1;
00804                 d = c;
00805                 c = b;
00806                 b = a;
00807                 a = T1 + T2;
00808 
00809                 j++;
00810         } while (j < 16);
00811 
00812         do {
00813                 /* Part of the message block expansion: */
00814                 s0 = W512[(j+1)&0x0f];
00815                 s0 = sigma0_512(s0);
00816                 s1 = W512[(j+14)&0x0f];
00817                 s1 =  sigma1_512(s1);
00818 
00819                 /* Apply the SHA-512 compression function to update a..h */
00820                 T1 = h + Sigma1_512(e) + Ch(e, f, g) + K512[j] +
00821                      (W512[j&0x0f] += s1 + W512[(j+9)&0x0f] + s0);
00822                 T2 = Sigma0_512(a) + Maj(a, b, c);
00823                 h = g;
00824                 g = f;
00825                 f = e;
00826                 e = d + T1;
00827                 d = c;
00828                 c = b;
00829                 b = a;
00830                 a = T1 + T2;
00831 
00832                 j++;
00833         } while (j < 80);
00834 
00835         /* Compute the current intermediate hash value */
00836         context->state[0] += a;
00837         context->state[1] += b;
00838         context->state[2] += c;
00839         context->state[3] += d;
00840         context->state[4] += e;
00841         context->state[5] += f;
00842         context->state[6] += g;
00843         context->state[7] += h;
00844 
00845         /* Clean up */
00846         a = b = c = d = e = f = g = h = T1 = T2 = 0;
00847 }
00848 
00849 #endif /* SHA2_UNROLL_TRANSFORM */
00850 
00851 void sat_SHA512_Update(SHA512_CTX* context, const sha2_byte *data, size_t len) {
00852         unsigned int    freespace, usedspace;
00853 
00854         if (len == 0) {
00855                 /* Calling with no data is valid - we do nothing */
00856                 return;
00857         }
00858 
00859         /* Sanity check: */
00860         /* assert(context != (SHA512_CTX*)0 && data != (sha2_byte*)0); */
00861 
00862         usedspace = (context->bitcount[0] >> 3) % SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH;
00863         if (usedspace > 0) {
00864                 /* Calculate how much free space is available in the buffer */
00865                 freespace = SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH - usedspace;
00866 
00867                 if (len >= freespace) {
00868                         /* Fill the buffer completely and process it */
00869                         MEMCPY_BCOPY(&context->buffer[usedspace], data, freespace);
00870                         ADDINC128(context->bitcount, freespace << 3);
00871                         len -= freespace;
00872                         data += freespace;
00873                         SHA512_Transform(context, (sha2_word64*)context->buffer);
00874                 } else {
00875                         /* The buffer is not yet full */
00876                         MEMCPY_BCOPY(&context->buffer[usedspace], data, len);
00877                         ADDINC128(context->bitcount, len << 3);
00878                         /* Clean up: */
00879                         usedspace = freespace = 0;
00880                         return;
00881                 }
00882         }
00883         while (len >= SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH) {
00884                 /* Process as many complete blocks as we can */
00885                 SHA512_Transform(context, (sha2_word64*)data);
00886                 ADDINC128(context->bitcount, SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH << 3);
00887                 len -= SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH;
00888                 data += SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH;
00889         }
00890         if (len > 0) {
00891                 /* There's left-overs, so save 'em */
00892                 MEMCPY_BCOPY(context->buffer, data, len);
00893                 ADDINC128(context->bitcount, len << 3);
00894         }
00895         /* Clean up: */
00896         usedspace = freespace = 0;
00897 }
00898 
00899 static void SHA512_Last(SHA512_CTX* context) {
00900         unsigned int    usedspace;
00901 
00902         usedspace = (context->bitcount[0] >> 3) % SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH;
00903 #if __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN
00904         /* Convert FROM host byte order */
00905         REVERSE64(context->bitcount[0],context->bitcount[0]);
00906         REVERSE64(context->bitcount[1],context->bitcount[1]);
00907 #endif
00908         if (usedspace > 0) {
00909                 /* Begin padding with a 1 bit: */
00910                 context->buffer[usedspace++] = 0x80;
00911 
00912                 if (usedspace <= SHA512_SHORT_BLOCK_LENGTH) {
00913                         /* Set-up for the last transform: */
00914                         MEMSET_BZERO(&context->buffer[usedspace], SHA512_SHORT_BLOCK_LENGTH - usedspace);
00915                 } else {
00916                         if (usedspace < SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH) {
00917                                 MEMSET_BZERO(&context->buffer[usedspace], SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH - usedspace);
00918                         }
00919                         /* Do second-to-last transform: */
00920                         SHA512_Transform(context, (sha2_word64*)context->buffer);
00921 
00922                         /* And set-up for the last transform: */
00923                         MEMSET_BZERO(context->buffer, SHA512_BLOCK_LENGTH - 2);
00924                 }
00925         } else {
00926                 /* Prepare for final transform: */
00927                 MEMSET_BZERO(context->buffer, SHA512_SHORT_BLOCK_LENGTH);
00928 
00929                 /* Begin padding with a 1 bit: */
00930                 *context->buffer = 0x80;
00931         }
00932         /* Store the length of input data (in bits): */
00933         *(sha2_word64*)&context->buffer[SHA512_SHORT_BLOCK_LENGTH] = context->bitcount[1];
00934         *(sha2_word64*)&context->buffer[SHA512_SHORT_BLOCK_LENGTH+8] = context->bitcount[0];
00935 
00936         /* Final transform: */
00937         SHA512_Transform(context, (sha2_word64*)context->buffer);
00938 }
00939 
00940 void sat_SHA512_Final(sha2_byte digest[], SHA512_CTX* context) {
00941         sha2_word64     *d = (sha2_word64*)digest;
00942 
00943         /* Sanity check: */
00944         /* assert(context != (SHA512_CTX*)0); */
00945 
00946         /* If no digest buffer is passed, we don't bother doing this: */
00947         if (digest != (sha2_byte*)0) {
00948                 SHA512_Last(context);
00949 
00950                 /* Save the hash data for output: */
00951 #if __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN
00952                 {
00953                         /* Convert TO host byte order */
00954                         int     j;
00955                         for (j = 0; j < 8; j++) {
00956                                 REVERSE64(context->state[j],context->state[j]);
00957                                 *d++ = context->state[j];
00958                         }
00959                 }
00960 #else
00961                 MEMCPY_BCOPY(d, context->state, SHA512_DIGEST_LENGTH);
00962 #endif
00963         }
00964 
00965         /* Zero out state data */
00966         MEMSET_BZERO(context, sizeof(context));
00967 }
00968 
00969 char *sat_SHA512_End(SHA512_CTX* context, char buffer[]) {
00970         sha2_byte       digest[SHA512_DIGEST_LENGTH], *d = digest;
00971         int             i;
00972 
00973         /* Sanity check: */
00974         /* assert(context != (SHA512_CTX*)0); */
00975 
00976         if (buffer != (char*)0) {
00977                 sat_SHA512_Final(digest, context);
00978 
00979                 for (i = 0; i < SHA512_DIGEST_LENGTH; i++) {
00980                         *buffer++ = sha2_hex_digits[(*d & 0xf0) >> 4];
00981                         *buffer++ = sha2_hex_digits[*d & 0x0f];
00982                         d++;
00983                 }
00984                 *buffer = (char)0;
00985         } else {
00986                 MEMSET_BZERO(context, sizeof(context));
00987         }
00988         MEMSET_BZERO(digest, SHA512_DIGEST_LENGTH);
00989         return buffer;
00990 }
00991 
00992 char* sat_SHA512_Data(const sha2_byte* data, size_t len, char digest[SHA512_DIGEST_STRING_LENGTH]) {
00993         SHA512_CTX      context;
00994 
00995         sat_SHA512_Init(&context);
00996         sat_SHA512_Update(&context, data, len);
00997         return sat_SHA512_End(&context, digest);
00998 }
00999 
01000 
01001 /*** SHA-384: *********************************************************/
01002 void sat_SHA384_Init(SHA384_CTX* context) {
01003         if (context == (SHA384_CTX*)0) {
01004                 return;
01005         }
01006         MEMCPY_BCOPY(context->state, sha384_initial_hash_value, SHA512_DIGEST_LENGTH);
01007         MEMSET_BZERO(context->buffer, SHA384_BLOCK_LENGTH);
01008         context->bitcount[0] = context->bitcount[1] = 0;
01009 }
01010 
01011 void sat_SHA384_Update(SHA384_CTX* context, const sha2_byte* data, size_t len) {
01012         sat_SHA512_Update((SHA512_CTX*)context, data, len);
01013 }
01014 
01015 void sat_SHA384_Final(sha2_byte digest[], SHA384_CTX* context) {
01016         sha2_word64     *d = (sha2_word64*)digest;
01017 
01018         /* Sanity check: */
01019         /* assert(context != (SHA384_CTX*)0); */
01020 
01021         /* If no digest buffer is passed, we don't bother doing this: */
01022         if (digest != (sha2_byte*)0) {
01023                 SHA512_Last((SHA512_CTX*)context);
01024 
01025                 /* Save the hash data for output: */
01026 #if __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN
01027                 {
01028                         /* Convert TO host byte order */
01029                         int     j;
01030                         for (j = 0; j < 6; j++) {
01031                                 REVERSE64(context->state[j],context->state[j]);
01032                                 *d++ = context->state[j];
01033                         }
01034                 }
01035 #else
01036                 MEMCPY_BCOPY(d, context->state, SHA384_DIGEST_LENGTH);
01037 #endif
01038         }
01039 
01040         /* Zero out state data */
01041         MEMSET_BZERO(context, sizeof(context));
01042 }
01043 
01044 char *sat_SHA384_End(SHA384_CTX* context, char buffer[]) {
01045         sha2_byte       digest[SHA384_DIGEST_LENGTH], *d = digest;
01046         int             i;
01047 
01048         /* Sanity check: */
01049         /* assert(context != (SHA384_CTX*)0); */
01050 
01051         if (buffer != (char*)0) {
01052                 sat_SHA384_Final(digest, context);
01053 
01054                 for (i = 0; i < SHA384_DIGEST_LENGTH; i++) {
01055                         *buffer++ = sha2_hex_digits[(*d & 0xf0) >> 4];
01056                         *buffer++ = sha2_hex_digits[*d & 0x0f];
01057                         d++;
01058                 }
01059                 *buffer = (char)0;
01060         } else {
01061                 MEMSET_BZERO(context, sizeof(context));
01062         }
01063         MEMSET_BZERO(digest, SHA384_DIGEST_LENGTH);
01064         return buffer;
01065 }
01066 
01067 char* sat_SHA384_Data(const sha2_byte* data, size_t len, char digest[SHA384_DIGEST_STRING_LENGTH]) {
01068         SHA384_CTX      context;
01069 
01070         sat_SHA384_Init(&context);
01071         sat_SHA384_Update(&context, data, len);
01072         return sat_SHA384_End(&context, digest);
01073 }
